programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1990's drug gangs terrorized Harlem, New York neighborhoods. When a 10-year-old boy fell victim in the crossfire, NYPD detectives and FBI agents clamped down on the problem. They formed a task force called C-11, designed to dismantle the gangs. In an environment of violence and fear it would be difficult to identify, arrest and convict those involved in the secretive and deadly world of big money drugs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1994, a teenage immigrant came to the United States to realize her dream of becoming a doctor. But a tragic twist of fate intervened, when she found herself an innocent victim of the drug trade. Kidnapped and held captive, she survived for days against all odds. Authorities arrested her captors, but they refused to reveal her whereabouts. The FBI and local police raced against time, determined to save the teenager's life. Their investigation revealed a complex story of drugs, betrayal and revenge.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Beginning in California in 1995, a serial killer targeted vulnerable women. At first charming and generous, he quickly became violent. He was brutal with his kills and quick in his getaways. Traveling across the country, he struck in Mississippi, Louisiana and Florida. The FBI and local police needed to stop this cross-country killer before more women fell victim to his insatiable rage.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By April of 1995 in Washington, D.C., two officers had been shot and one had been murdered. Each had been sitting in their patrol cars when a man sneaked up and opened fire. The FBI was brought in to help catch the cop killer. Agents identified the man who was most likely the killer, but he was nowhere to be found. Months of surveillance operations around the country finally yielded a break; they found their suspect in Baltimore, MD.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In November of 1994, when a Wells Fargo armored van disappeared from a Glendale, Arizona mall, local authorities and the FBI scrambled to recover it, and its cargo of nearly a million dollars. Six hours later, agents found the van, its driver shot dead inside and the money gone. It was a perfect hit by professionals who left no clue behind. Months passed before a solid lead developed. In January, a tip led agents to look into a former prison guard.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Kokomo, Indiana an unthinkable crime terrified residents. A young woman was snatched from her home on a bright spring morning. Drops of blood and a torn window screen were all that was left to tell authorities what happened to the twenty-one year old victim. After several days of searching, a former FBI profiler narrowed the suspect list to one. Agents and detectives followed the trail across state lines hoping to find the victim before her time ran out.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 3, 1990, a 14-year-old girl ran away from her mother's home and disappeared without a trace. Her mother hoped Pasadena, Texas police could find her before it was too late. Six months later, their worst fear was realized when a farmer discovered the young girl's remains in an Illinois barn. The FBI was called in to help. Agents tracked down a trucker who they believed was responsible for 50 more deaths. Investigators knew they had to stop this menace of the highways.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, the decapitation of a young African-American male led the Miami-Dade police department and the FBI along a trail of murder. Investigators quickly discovered that the victim was a dissident member of a religious sect headed by a man calling himself Yahweh ben Yahweh, or God, Son of God. Although the FBI believed Yahweh ben Yahweh and his followers were responsible for many murders, they could find no direct evidence linking them to the crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Anchorage, Alaska, a young mother and her two daughters were sexually assaulted and brutally murdered. There was only one piece of forensic evidence: a washrag carrying pubic lice that the killer used to clean himself after the crime. Employing an unusual and original method, an FBI expert combed through all the hairs and fibers in the apartment. He was not only able to determine how long each hair had been there, but which hairs came from the killer and how the crime proceeded.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El primero de octubre de 1993, un extraño secuestró a Polly Klaas de doce años durante una piyamada en su casa. El FBI de inmediato entró en el caso. Los agentes reunieron fibras de su habitación y descubrieron, a través del uso de fuentes de luz láser, la huella de una palma en la cama de Polly, previamente invisible al ojo humano. Después de una extensa investigación de dos meses, el FBI arrestó a Richard Allen Davis. La impresión de la palma y las fibras coincidieron y Davis fue condenado por secuestro y asesinato.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1990's drug gangs terrorized Harlem, New York neighborhoods. When a 10-year-old boy fell victim in the crossfire, NYPD detectives and FBI agents clamped down on the problem. They formed a task force called C-11, designed to dismantle the gangs. In an environment of violence and fear it would be difficult to identify, arrest and convict those involved in the secretive and deadly world of big money drugs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. Then, family members offered a startling clue. The victim, the wife of a prominent Atlanta attorney, was also a woman burdened with a secret; a secret the FBI believed led to her death. It would force local and federal agents to untangle an intricate web of money, drugs and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On June 21, 1964, three civil rights workers, two white and one black disappeared in Mississippi while passing through Neshoba County. A massive FBI investigation led to the recovery of the bodies of the slain men and physical evidence was recovered and analyzed. The FBI labs confirmed that all but one of the bullets used to kill the men came from the same gun. The FBI gained the trust of an informant, whose information led to the conviction of seven local Ku Klux Klan members.

programme.title: Meet, Marry, Murder
programme.desc: Lois Riess was a gambling addict who would do anything to feed her habit. Even go on a killing and robbing spree across America.

programme.desc: A double murderer is found guilty of the brutal assassination of an elderly couple.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: A jailing for the shocking murder of author Helen Bailey leads to a second conviction of another.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: Pawel Relowicz rapes and kills 21-year-old Hull student Libby Squire in a case that made headlines around the UK.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers
programme.desc: The story of 27-year-old Pawel Relowicz, who raped and killed 21-year-old Hull student Libby Squire.

programme.title: World's Most Evil Killers

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. In this Bloomberg Originals documentary, we reveal how the unregulated substance is being promoted and even made more potent, and how some users are ending up dead.

programme.desc: Refugees Welcome documents how one Governor’s brave decision to welcome refugees during the Vietnam War had far reaching repercussions not only for the country but, generations later, for the fate of his own family.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Meet a pair of dueling Creole dishes when Chef Eric Cook of Gris Gris battles it out against Chef Ericka Michelle Lassair of Diva Dawg. Will “Chef Diva’s” signature sauce stump her worthy opponent, or will “Cookie” manage to pull a rabbit out of a chef’s hat?

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: These criminals may not have blood on their hands, but they still leave despair in their wake. From shady non-profits to fraudulent contractors, to wide-spread postal theft, here are some of the most devastating white-collar crimes to be attempted across the country.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: A resilient family bands together after their mother is tragically murdered by her husband. Ryan and Justin help to memorialize her legacy by purchasing a headstone for her gravesite.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A serial killer preys on women from a hardscrabble section of Daytona Beach, Florida. Detectives have boxes of DNA and ballistic evidence. They just don't have a suspect.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Word is this surprising city has a literary speakeasy. Meet a father-daughter duo who is disrupting the local food scene. Explore a historic man cave and pluck fruit from a tree that grows lemons and oranges. Also: archery! And, pancakes!

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day travel to Homewood to see if they have what it takes to be urban beekeepers, elite barbers, and African dancers and drummers.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob tests out all types of relaxation, from sound baths to flinging an axe, discovers exciting new cuisine and quenches his thirst in this diverse and hopping Boston ‘hood.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: At only 21 years old, Isabelle Sander has overcome a lot in her young life with hearing loss. However, to prove to herself and others that a diagnosis doesn't define a person, she is on a mission to participate in nature and be active outdoors.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: This is the formal food frenzy you don't want to miss. Chefs Tyler Johnson and Ben Lefenfeld are getting bougie for this Black Tie Dinner challenge. Whose meal will win best dressed?

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate regains her faith in the classic Hurricane, talks history and equity in the cocktail industry, pledges allegiance to the French 75, and dives into a rich New Orleans cocktail culture that’s much bigger than Bourbon Street.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: There's nothing like a good sandwich. From smoked salmon, to build-your-own burgers, Baltimore's handhelds game is on point.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Ryan, Justin, and Jimmy enjoy a Cincinnati summer playing pickleball for charity. Ryan and Jimmy compete in an ice cream taste test. Later, Justin takes a young lady on a shopping spree to celebrate her resilience in addressing her mental health.

programme.title: Silver Linings
programme.desc: Welcome to Lancaster, PA, one of the country's hottest retirement hubs. Here, seniors, from a beauty pageant queen to a 90 year-old swim champion aren’t slowing down; they’re rewriting the playbook and redefining aging in America.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Aaron Poret of Bywater American Bistro goes head to head with Chef Jas Rogers, Owner and Creator of Saucex Dat. Will fried dough foil Chef Poret’s chances of success, or will he rise to Chef Rogers’ challenge?

programme.title: Hour Long Docs List
programme.desc: A playlist of hour long VL Originals

programme.title: Bringing Down The House: The Bombing of Harvey's Casino
programme.desc: In the summer of 1980, two men wheeled what looked like an IBM computer into a Lake Tahoe casino. The events that followed rocked the industry, baffled bomb technicians, and changed the lives of a criminal’s and a casino magnate’s family forever.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Orlando expert, Brendan O'Connor, celebrates the people behind the scenes of the businesses that make Orlando a truly unique place. Join him as he rolls up his sleeves and receives hands on training while spending a day with them, On The Job.

programme.title: On The Job: Coast To Coast
programme.desc: Host Traci Stumpf gets her hands dirty learning to do some of the country's most essential jobs. From waste removal, to power cleaning, to wine making, she gains new respect for the people who keep our communities clean, bright, and happy.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: No one knows a city like the locals who live there. This series taps into the insider knowledge of notable figures including musicians, athletes, chefs, artists, influencers, and others who share their best spots to hit up in the city.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Maker Nation
programme.desc: Maker Nation

programme.title: Maker Nation Challenge
programme.desc: Makers, crafters and artists square off to create the most iconic art piece that best represents their city. From glass-blowers and chalk artists to metalsmiths and tattooers, see who Host Ashley Adams and the judges will crown the victor.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Knoxville, Tennessee to meet people who are experiencing homelessness because their wages can’t cover the cost of rent. Plus, a family law scholar looks at the future of reproductive rights under the Trump administration. And, people over 50 deal with high student loan debt balances.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: Runner-in-Chief Jeff Dengate, presents inspiring runner stories from around the country. Meet runners from Colorado, New Jersey, Kentucky and Pennsylvania who are making a difference.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Automation for Ballin' in Baltimore

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Stitch showcases the feel-good and do-good that make up the fabric of America from inspiring tales of perseverance, to good Samaritans helping neighbors, to trailblazers improving their communities.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Kar is a selfless soul known for his unwavering commitment to the unhoused in his community. It's Kar's turn to have some good old-fashioned fun.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Celebrate some of the Midwest's holiday favorites. Where scotcheroos take center stage, snicker salads delight, and the pink stuff surprises the pallet.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Polo King's Deadly Hit And Run
programme.desc: Florida polo enthusiast and billionaire, John Goodman, blows through a stop sign and slams into another car killing a college student. And a celebrity publicist backs her SUV into a crowd outside a nightclub, then flees the scene.

programme.title: From Student Seduction To Murder
programme.desc: High school staffer, Pamela Smart, becomes a household name when she starts a love affair with a student, who she convinces to kill her husband. This tale of illicit sex and murder for insurance money become a real-life American soap opera.

programme.title: North Hollywood Gun Battle
programme.desc: Los Angeles police respond to a bank heist and find they are outgunned by the robbers. Citizens and police run for cover in a brazen deadly shootout.

programme.title: Dark Family Secrets Turn Deadly
programme.desc: A son beats his mother to death in a savage attack. Also, star running back, Maurice Clarett, finds his hardest hit comes off the field when he turns from football to crime.

programme.title: Attempt To Kill A President
programme.desc: Obsessed stalker, John Hinkley Jr., will do anything to gain fame and the attention of a young Hollywood star, even if it means killing the President of the United States. And an ambitious lab worker derails the criminal justice system in one state resulting in freedom for convicted criminals.

programme.title: Black Widows
programme.desc: Two elderly Los Angeles widows target homeless men in their deadly plots to cash in on murder. And, charismatic art investor, Kenneth Ira Starr, bilks Hollywood celebrities out of millions of dollars.

programme.title: The Inside Story

programme.title: Arctic Animals
programme.desc: In this episode, we'll feature animals that live in the freezing arctic. Learn how the Polar Bear has developed special adaptations that help it survive in the most unforgiving climate imaginable. And why the Wolverine is able to hunt so efficiently in the snow.

programme.title: Man's Best Friend
programme.desc: In this episode, we examine the science behind man's best friend - the dog. Find out what makes a greyhound so fast. See how a bloodhound's nose really works, and the reason that border collies are so intelligent is revealed.

programme.title: Deserts
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau visits the Mohave Desert, and discovers how varied deserts can be; some deserts are covered with sand dunes, while others have amazing vegetation. We also travel to Death Valley, the hottest spot in North America. Then we explore the Joshua Tree National Park, which has the unusual Joshua tree, and many other exotic plants.

programme.title: Canyons
programme.desc: Host Philippe Cousteau travels to the Grand Canyon by helicopter, and gives us a close look at this amazing canyon, which is considered one of the seven natural wonders of the world. We'll also visit Bryce Canyon and its fascinating "hoodoos," which are rock formations sculpted by weather. We'll also dive into the Monterrey Bay and discover an incredible underwater canyon that features some unusual sea creatures.

programme.title: Primarily Primates
programme.desc: In this episode we meet human's closest relatives - primates. See what makes a chimpanzee one of the most intelligent primates. Find out why the spider monkey is such an amazing climber and feel the power of the howler monkey's howl.

programme.title: Surf and Turf
programme.desc: In this episode we'll find out how sharks use electro-sensors to detect their prey. Also, discover the skunk's stinky defense mechanism. And domestic versus wild - see how the striped zebra matches up against its cousin the horse.

programme.title: Big Sur
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Big Sur

programme.title: Oregon Coast
programme.desc: Jefferson Graham takes us on a photowalk through Oregon Coast

programme.title: Afghanistan Withdrawal
programme.desc: Scripps News explores the lives impacted by the U.S. troop withdrawal from Afghanistan in 2021. Critics say the government's decision lacked foresight, ultimately forcing the U.S. to take on tens of thousands of refugees. More than two years later, those refugees are still struggling to get back on their feet.

programme.title: Hurricane Michael
programme.desc: A look at how rebuilding efforts are going for Florida families that lost everything in the category 5 Hurricane Michael that made landfall in the FL panhandle on October 7, 2018. The episode goes into the complicated insurance process and how disasters price out people that used to live there. Several FL stations' coverage and talent featured in the episode.

programme.title: Independent America
programme.desc: Independent voters discuss a range of issues, including inflation, immigration, and abortion. In this special 1-hour documentary, correspondent Gianna Toboni spends time with voters in their daily lives to see how the major issues are impacting them on a personal level.

programme.title: Rhode Island Ripper
programme.desc: Women in a working-class Rhode Island town begin mysteriously disappearing. Cops investigate and discover the dark obsession of a serial killer nobody suspected.

programme.title: Cleveland Killer
programme.desc: A damaged man turns Cleveland, Ohio into a hunting ground as part of a twisted plot to exact revenge on the women who hurt him. After 10 months of terror, can cops bring him to justice?

programme.title: New Orleans Massacre
programme.desc: A merciless triple homicide in New Orleans, Louisiana leaves law enforcement with puzzling clues. But as they piece together the mystery, they quickly realize there is more to the murders than a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: The Missing Pendant
programme.desc: The grisly murder of a grandmother in the suburbs of Cincinnati, Ohio sends a small-town police department into a fast and furious hunt for a killer. It takes nearly a year, a microscopic clue, and a piece of jewelry as unique as a fingerprint for law enforcement to bring the murderer to justice.

programme.title: The Informant
programme.desc: In Southern California, law enforcement hunt for a serial killer who is targeting elderly women within a few mile radius. After weeks of searching, a survivor comes forward with a description that blows the case wide open.

programme.title: Bayou Strangler
programme.desc: A serial predator terrorizes Southeastern Louisiana, strangling men to death and disposing of their bodies like trash. This deranged killer gets away with murder for nearly a decade until a potential victim escapes his clutches and then leads police right to the killer's doorstep.

programme.title: Cold Storage Killer
programme.desc: Police follow the trail of a young Southern California woman who vanishes without a trace. Authorities work the missing person investigation for years until a random encounter turns them onto a chilling discovery and an even colder criminal.

programme.title: Nameless in New Jersey
programme.desc: The discovery of a Jane Doe underneath a New Jersey bridge kick starts an intensive investigation to figure out who she is and how she died. Law enforcement uses a combination of forensic evidence and eyewitnesses to solve the mystery and bring a murderer to justice.

programme.title: Hour Long Docs List
programme.desc: A playlist of hour long VL Originals

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Sometimes, would-be criminals are their own worst enemies. This episode highlights crime “fails,” and the officers - and ordinary civilians - who save the day.

programme.title: Americas Most Delish
programme.desc: Discover where classic dishes collide to create delightful flavors. From pizza debates to the Juicy Lucy to a good old-fashioned red beer, see how regional creativity transforms beloved foods into something more.

programme.title: My Perfect Day
programme.desc: Catalina, a 10-year-old community hero with a heart of gold spends her days giving back. Today, Meaghan surprises Catalina with a day of her own, from Sea adventures to a new set of wheels and more. It's her time to shine.

programme.title: On The Job
programme.desc: Brendan spruces up a home for a pair of bald eagles at a predatory bird rehabilitation center, preserves the history and legacy of one of Orlando's most infamous figures, and becomes a mixologist at the trendiest cocktail bar in town.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: A duo pulls a Bonnie and Clyde in a truck stolen from a dealership, and a pair takes money from a monastery. These shocking stories of couples in crime have to be witnessed to be believed.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Camryn Simpson, a 21-year-old student at the University of Pittsburgh and ambassador on social media platforms can’t take time away from her phone. With the help of Kinga, Camryn will log-out of social media and log-in to the outdoors to find adventure.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Sierra Lamar leaves for school one morning and vanishes with barely a trace, setting in motion one of the largest searches in U.S. history. The community and investigators still have unanswered questions.

programme.title: Widowed At 19
programme.desc: Two high school sweethearts had their love story cut too short.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed and Day make gnocci and join in on a Hearts of Steel rowing team practice along the Allegheny River before ending the day at Grist House Craft Brewery in Millvale.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Love hurts: These are real-life stories of Americans who were swindled by people who claimed to love them.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In a serene community, a beloved doctor is bludgeoned in her own home. Investigators uncover a conspiracy that rocks the close-knit neighborhood to its core​​.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Aaron Poret of Bywater American Bistro goes head to head with Chef Jas Rogers, Owner and Creator of Saucex Dat. Will fried dough foil Chef Poret’s chances of success, or will he rise to Chef Rogers’ challenge?

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: Our KC experts include a Savage X Fenty model who also walks his own line, an MTV star who's turning carnivores on to the #plantlife and a local blogger with the scoop on where to let your dog off-leash while enjoying an adult beverage.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Justin tests his mettle to see if he can compete in the Ironman World Championship. With only seven months to train and no prior experience, can Justin pull off this amazing fitness feat?

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: With award-winning Chef Marie Yniguez, Amanda forages for wild ingredients along the Rio Grande, makes paletas—Mexican popsicles— from scratch, and enters a high pressure cooking competition.

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Celebrating veterans, acknowledging their service and sacrifices

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a coffeeshop chain to snowy railroad tracks, these unconventional crime scenes bring the childhood game of Cops & Robbers to life.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Mermaids, donuts, trains, and breaking stuff. Maddy & Dixie take a trip down memory lane in Sacramento and bring viewers to spots that remind them of childhood, with a grown-up twist.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh
programme.desc: Ed & Day reconnect with their youth, work on their flexibility in an artistic way, and explore local beer culture at Allegheny City Brewing in the Northside.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: On two blind dates in Orlando, local couples cozy up over bird watching, spy friendly gators, sample decadent desserts, and get loose on game night.

programme.title: Human Race by Runner's World
programme.desc: 84% of women have been harassed while running. Not Today, by Runner's World, examines this through the stories of three runners. Mollie Tibbetts and Wendy Martinez were both brutally murdered, while Kelly Herron fought off her attacker and survived.

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: Maxwell, a young professional, is taking a chance on love with three blind dates. Will things get playful with Hannah, stay sweet with Kambree or will Maxwell cross the finish line with Paige?

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Local radio personality, Greg Adams, wants to shine a light on all parts of his beloved city and prove that Milwaukee has a lot more to offer than people might expect. In each episode, Greg is joined by a notable personality from the community who shows him their favorite spots and the best ways to experience them.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Crimes, Cons & Capers explores some of the wildest headline-grabbing crimes and far-fetched escapades from across the country including bizarre love scams, high-speed car chases, risky prison breaks and more.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Matter of Fact
programme.desc: This week Matter of Fact travels to Knoxville, Tennessee to meet people who are experiencing homelessness because their wages can’t cover the cost of rent. Plus, a family law scholar looks at the future of reproductive rights under the Trump administration. And, people over 50 deal with high student loan debt balances.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: A look at daring escapes from custody and the breakouts that take on many forms – yet always involve finding and exploiting the weakest parts of the system.

programme.title: Wait, What Happened?
programme.desc: In this game show, comedian Frank Nicotero hits the streets to ask people questions inspired by the wildest news stories for a chance at winning a cash prize. These real-life stories with unreal outcomes will make you say, “Wait, What Happened?"

programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: Meet some of New England's greatest hockey players, from NHL pros to high school's rising stars, and get to know them off the ice.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Join host Rob Mariano, also known as Boston Rob from the Survivor series, as he explores the best of Beantown from classic institutions to new local gems.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.desc: Scripps News explores the lives impacted by the U.S. troop withdrawal from Afghanistan in 2021. More than two years later, those refugees are still struggling to get back on their feet.

programme.title: Rhode Island Ripper

programme.title: Afghanistan Withdrawal
programme.desc: Scripps News explores the lives impacted by the U.S. troop withdrawal from Afghanistan in 2021. Critics say the government's decision lacked foresight, ultimately forcing the U.S. to take on tens of thousands of refugees. More than two years later, those refugees are still struggling to get back on their feet.

programme.title: Hurricane Michael
programme.desc: A look at how rebuilding efforts are going for Florida families that lost everything in the category 5 Hurricane Michael that made landfall in the FL panhandle on October 7, 2018. programme.title: Rhode Island Ripper

programme.title: Cleveland Killer
programme.desc: A damaged man turns Cleveland, Ohio into a hunting ground as part of a twisted plot to exact revenge on the women who hurt him. After 10 months of terror, can cops bring him to justice?

programme.title: New Orleans Massacre
programme.desc: A merciless triple homicide in New Orleans, Louisiana leaves law enforcement with puzzling clues. But as they piece together the mystery, they quickly realize there is more to the murders than a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: The Missing Pendant
programme.desc: The grisly murder of a grandmother in the suburbs of Cincinnati, Ohio sends a small-town police department into a fast and furious hunt for a killer. It takes nearly a year, a microscopic clue, and a piece of jewelry as unique as a fingerprint for law enforcement to bring the murderer to justice.

programme.title: The Informant
programme.desc: In Southern California, law enforcement hunt for a serial killer who is targeting elderly women within a few mile radius. After weeks of searching, a survivor comes forward with a description that blows the case wide open.

programme.title: Bayou Strangler
programme.desc: A serial predator terrorizes Southeastern Louisiana, strangling men to death and disposing of their bodies like trash. This deranged killer gets away with murder for nearly a decade until a potential victim escapes his clutches and then leads police right to the killer's doorstep.
